metadata.description: Required. Name of your Azure container registry.
Optional. Enable admin user that have push / pull permission to the registry.
Optional. Location for all resources.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. Tier of your Azure container registry.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the export policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the quarantine policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the trust policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the retention policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The number of days to retain an untagged manifest after which it gets purged.
Optional. Enable a single data endpoint per region for serving data. Not relevant in case of disabled public access.
Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set.
Optional. Whether to allow trusted Azure services to access a network restricted registry. Not relevant in case of public access. - AzureServices or None.
Optional. The default action of allow or deny when no other rules match.
Optional. The IP ACL rules.
Optional. Whether or not zone redundancy is enabled for this container registry.
Optional. All replications to create.
Optional. All webhooks to create.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed.
Optional. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from. Note, CMK requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption. Note, CMK requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, the latest key version is used.
Conditional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Note, CMK requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'. Required if 'cMKKeyName' is not empty.

properties.encryption: [if(not(empty(parameters('cMKKeyName'))), createObject('status', 'enabled', 'keyVaultProperties', createObject('identity', reference(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(parameters('cMKUserAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '/')[2], split(parameters('cMKUserAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities', last(split(parameters('cMKUserAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '/'))), '2018-11-30').clientId, 'keyIdentifier', if(not(empty(parameters('cMKKeyVersion'))), format('{0}/{1}', reference(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')[2], split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys', split(format('{0}/{1}', last(split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')), parameters('cMKKeyName')), '/')[0], split(format('{0}/{1}', last(split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')), parameters('cMKKeyName')), '/')[1]), '2021-10-01').keyUri, parameters('cMKKeyVersion')), reference(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')[2], split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys', split(format('{0}/{1}', last(split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')), parameters('cMKKeyName')), '/')[0], split(format('{0}/{1}', last(split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')), parameters('cMKKeyName')), '/')[1]), '2021-10-01').keyUriWithVersion))), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent registry. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the replication.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.

Optional. Specifies whether the replication regional endpoint is enabled. Requests will not be routed to a replication whose regional endpoint is disabled, however its data will continue to be synced with other replications.
Optional. Whether or not zone redundancy is enabled for this container registry.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The name of the replication.
The resource ID of the replication.
The name of the resource group the replication was created in.
The location the resource was deployed into.
Conditional. The name of the parent registry. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The name of the registry webhook.
Required. The service URI for the webhook to post notifications.
Optional. The status of the webhook at the time the operation was called.
Optional. The list of actions that trigger the webhook to post notifications.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Custom headers that will be added to the webhook notifications.

Optional. The scope of repositories where the event can be triggered. For example, 'foo:*' means events for all tags under repository 'foo'. 'foo:bar' means events for 'foo:bar' only. 'foo' is equivalent to 'foo:latest'. Empty means all events.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The resource ID of the webhook.
The name of the webhook.
The name of the Azure container registry.
The actions of the webhook.
The status of the webhook.
The provisioning state of the webhook.
The location the resource was deployed into.
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Required. Resource ID of the resource that needs to be connected to the network.
Required. Subtype(s) of the connection to be created. The allowed values depend on the type serviceResourceId refers to.
Optional. The private DNS zone group configuration used to associate the private endpoint with one or multiple private DNS zones. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone resource IDs. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The Name of the Azure container registry.
The reference to the Azure container registry.
The name of the Azure container registry.
The resource ID of the Azure container registry.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
